alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascade Foothills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 3:05AM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT FOR ELEVATIONS BELOW 1500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 1500 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 feet possible. Highest amounts above 2000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch below 1500 feet, heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 10 inches and ice accumulations of around one quarter of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...In Oregon, Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills and Cascade Foothills in Lane County. In Washington, South Washington Cascade Foothills. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult above 1500 feet. Gusty winds could cause white-out conditions at times. Ice accumulation and gusty winds could bring down tree branches, leading to power outages. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For elevations below 1500 feet, snow will likely begin Friday evening but will likely not accumulate on surfaces until later Friday night. Freezing rain may begin Friday night continuing through Saturday. Snow and ice amounts as well as the exact location of these hazards will depend on many variables.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
